BasicIO

Class BinaryOutputFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • BasicIO.BinaryOutputFile

  • public class BinaryOutputFile
extends java.lang.Object
    BinaryOutputFile writes binary data to a file. The specified data type is written to a file in its binary representation. If an Object is being written, then serialization will occur. If the data can not be written to the file, either due to lack of space, or the file can not be found, then the successful method will return false.
    Version:
    1.0 July 08
    Author:
    A. Cheesman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryOutputFile()
      Constructs an BinaryOutputFile, prompting the user via Dialog Box for a file to write to.

      Constructs an BinaryOutputFile using the file provided.
      BinaryOutputFile(java.lang.String filename)
      Constructs an BinaryOutputFile and tries to open a file with the path provided in the String.

      • successful

        public boolean successful()
        Indicates whether or not the previous operation was successful. If it was a write operation, failure indicates the write was not possible (usually some I/O error). If it was a close operation, failure indicates inability to close the stream. The stream may subsequently be inaccessable.
        Returns:
        boolean: whether last operation was successful
